name: How do you see all your real estate portfolio data?

options.1: All data is at the site
options.2: Some data is shared in the scheduled meetings
options.3: Monthly information is shared through an email
options.4: We have a centralized dashboard where all portfolio is connected
options.5: The dashboard is comparing in real time all relevant real estate data based on predefined alarms and threshold

name: Are you predictive behaviour of assets and equipment?

options.1: Operation is on a reactive basis, and we are not able to predict failures.
options.2: We have PPM system in place, and we think to move into prediction.
options.3: We tracked historical data, and technical experience helps to predict behaviour
options.4: Data of past incidents is centralized in FMECA software used by the technical team
options.5: We adopted ML AI-based based technologies that are reading historical data, and FMECA helps us predicting behaviour.

name: How you monitor de financial data?

options.1: The financial team is presenting on request reports
options.2: The financial group is sending monthly, or weekly excel reports to tseam
options.3: It is software where everyone can read his relevant data
options.4: Software is connected to a Dashboard that presents the live situation
options.5: The dashboard predicts financial health, gives insights and drives decision making to different scenarios based on business flow.

name: Shutdown activities

options.1: No Planning and proper budgeting  and timelines are
options.2: Centralized on excel tracker, we handle it, but budget numbers are coming late and inaccurate.
options.3: We have a good team that maintains control in a few software's, and timelines and budget are delivered with some delays.
options.4: We have a great platform that allows us to be on time and touch budget limit
options.5: We have an integrated platform that allows us to be on time and below budgets

name: CAPEX work

options.1: We depend on vendors, and we do not validate or reconcile information.
options.2: Data is received from vendors or contractors; we rely heavily on their support from transition into operation
options.3: The operation team is handling an excel tracker and are coordinating the vendors through the program.
options.4: It is software that helps the team drive, monitor, collect and store all CAPEX activities.
options.5: The dashboard present and predict in real-time CAPEX to the all interested parties in the organization.

name: How you monitor occupier/tenant/workforce satisfaction

options.1: We don't do it
options.2: We conduct a yearly satisfaction survey
options.3: We are having a Call centre created.
options.4: It is software for ticketing system, and we inform monthly the results the management.
options.5: The dashboard takes the data from Satisfaction surveys, Ticketing system and presents live the trends and insights.

name: The organization has a strategic plan, and how is it communicated?

options.1: We might have
options.2: We have an old one, but we are not following it
options.3: We have recently developed it, but business is not aligned to it yet.
options.4: Only the top management are driving the strategic goals.
options.5: The KRAs of all staff are aligned to the strategic plan of the organization.

name: How is information shared within the organization?

options.1: Our information is own by departments, and centralization of data requires effort  what mostly inaccurate and late.
options.2:
We are using asset tagging, registers and through monthly meetings, we share the information among ourselves.
But is not verified the quality and accuracy of data and we rely on trust and people experience.
options.3:
Information is stored in different software solutions(Proptech, Propfin, IoT reading, etc.),
and we can download them in excel format. So we will collate the data in the monthly reports.
options.4: Information is collected into a common platform, and we can see the required data if we are looking for it.
options.5: Information is presented in Dashboards, and analytical formulas are helping us predicting trends and ease our decision-making process.

name: How Break and Fix and incident management is done?

options.1: The property management team is informed of the incident through SMS, Phone or Email sent by the Facility Management team.
options.2: The Property Management team is tracking the Unplanned Repair (R&M), and they have a budget for it. They are penalizing the FM team in case the Break and Fix budget is exceeded.
options.3: A CMMS system based on historical data and market benchmark creates the Plant Preventive Maintenance (PPM)  schedule to reduce R&M instances.
options.4: PPM is having a data collection from equipment's that allows the maintenance to change from Time based (TBM) to Condition-based Maintenance. (CBM)
options.5:
It is a complete integrated system where equipment's, historical data, FMECA, and IoT sensors monitor and
predicting real-time the Life Cycle. It is a blend of TBM, CBM, break and fix.

name: What scenario is relevant for your organization after a new software, hardware or asset was installed or upgraded?

options.1: Suppose driven by the department what it is using it. The training and induction are made unstructured, and follow up are almost inexistent.
options.2: The vendor is involved in the follow-up training of our staff, and when the problem occurs, internal teams must call the vendor. That takes time
options.3: We have an internal team trained by the vendor to fix 60% of the issues inside, so the integration is relatively smooth.
options.4: We have a dedicated department driving the integration of all new tech and hardware adoption, and they are a single point of contract to us.
options.5:
The unique integration team is constantly bridging the relation between company goals and the operation team by
driving technology and hardware adoption strategy on a corporate level.

name: Has your organization implemented operation information processes inter departments?

options.1: We are satisfied with our information management processes and see no need to change them
options.2: We currently do not use information standards across our departments but recognize their importance and look into solutions.
options.3:
We use a variety of information standards that differ across construction, procurement, operations and
maintenance tasks. They are relevant for the respective department and are not bridging the overall goal.
options.4: We have well-defined information processes, and we review them yearly
options.5: The specialist team is helping departments to find an immediate solution in case any information process brings delays or losses into any area of the business.

name: How would you rate the transparency and delivery latest major project you were involved?

options.1: We didn't have visibility.
options.2: We had limited visibility.
options.3: We had some visibility.
options.4: We had visibility but a significant delay in data.
options.5: We had complete visibility.

name: How you communicate alarms internally among teams?

options.1: We communicate only to the relevant department through phones, mostly
options.2: We share with the department, and afterwards, data is presented in the monthly meeting to other departments.
options.3: It is software that communicated to the respective department
options.4: The software displays among departments.
options.5: It is a centralized dashboard that is communicating relevant alarms on colour code through the organization.

name: Are you entering manual data in tasks?

options.1: Yes, everything is manual.
options.2: Yes, but we have some automation.
options.3: Yes, there are data entry tasks, and we are in the process of automating them.
options.4: Very few.
options.5: It is a complete system driven and limited manual entry.

name: Key performance indicators (KPI)

options.1: We do not use KPIs.
options.2: We have some visibility into KPIs
options.3: We run reports on KPIs weekly or monthly excel driven.
options.4: We have real-time visibility into our KPIs. Through software.
options.5: Through dashboards, corporate headquarters have complete real-time visibility into KPIs.

name: When undergoing large-scale engineering projects to update assets or plant systems:

options.1: We don't have means by which to validate or reconcile information from contractors and vendors.
options.2: Operational data remains largely as received from vendors or contractors; we rely heavily on their IT to support the transition into operation
options.3: Project delivery teams use software to provide post-project engineering information; internal IT helps manage and project information.
options.4: We have simplified control of engineering data and documents through software that ensures compliance and efficiency.
options.5: Our IT infrastructure fully manages and controls engineering information and drives the workflow of the asset information management processes.

name: How would you describe your organization's handling of engineering information?

options.1: Our engineering data remain in the format provided by the vendor, are not centrally located, and may not be digitized.
options.2: We rely on our IT departments to locate engineering information for us; the exact location of that information is unclear to departments outside of IT.
options.3: Our engineering data may be searchable but are not centrally located and can be difficult to verify.
options.4: Our engineering information is well organized and lives within a class library where it is searched by location, functional type, and physical equipment type.
options.5: Our teams have immediate access to reliable, accurate engineering information; changes to data are subject to rigorous change controls.

name: Your company's perspective on digital transformation

options.1: What is digital transformation?
options.2: We were talking, but we don't understand precisely what to do
options.3: We depend on the initiative of individuals, based on previous experience and skills, to adopt new initiatives that help in our digital transformation.
options.4: We have an internal team driving the Digital Transformation and aligns the company goals and mission to it.
options.5: We are using an experienced company to drive the Digital Transformation and is locked into the contract's success target for the next x years.

name: How do you report Sustainability, ESG and EHS targets towards stakeholders, government and other relevant institutions?

options.1: We collect data from departments on excel and is centralized into a report manually, but is no validation of data quality.
options.2: We collect data from departments on excel and are centralized into a report manually, with a good amount of validation.
options.3: We collect the data stored in software, and the report is made manually by a dedicated team.
options.4: Softwares are connected through API into a common database, and data is curated by a team that creates the report.
options.5:
We have Dashboards that are collecting real-time data from all IOT and relevant tech tools and software.
The dashboard is pushing the reports to relevant stakeholders based on automatic scheduling.

name: Through emails and phones.

options.1: Through emails and phones.
options.2: Through Email, phones and WhatsApp groups.
options.3: Through Email, phones, Shared drive and WhatsApp groups.
options.4: Through a variety of software's and Email, and WhatsApp, communication is reduced.
options.5: Through a corporate communication platform that reduced a lot of email use.
